In this spatial context—surrounded by designated shipping lanes, ferry routes, and harbor entrances—cargo vessels typically execute smooth, predictable turns to align with traffic flow under local vessel traffic service (VTS) guidelines. The observed behavior reflects controlled navigation along a curved route, likely entering a regulated channel or approaching a harbor, rather than maintaining open-sea straight-line transit.
